newsitem.title: USA: Advanced Micro cancels analyst meeting.
newsitem.headline: Advanced Micro cancels analyst meeting.

text.p: Advanced Micro Devices Inc said on Monday it had canceled an October 31 meeting with analysts, citing a California voter initiative known as Proposition 211.
The initiative, on the November 5 general election ballot, seeks to protect shareholders of public companies by broadening state securities fraud laws.

Proponents of the law believe it will make corporate officers more accountable. Opponents believe it will increase the number of securities lawsuits filed against companies and boost the cost of doing business.

Advanced Micro Devices said its meeting "has traditionally been a forum at which we attempt to provide insights into future directions of the company...passage of Proposition 211 would significantly increase the risk of frivolous stockholder lawsuits."
Several California companies, including semiconductor giant Intel Corp, have canceled analysts meetings or refused to make forward-looking comments in protest against Proposition 211.
